Author: namax#5496
Content: How do you use the DEX exactly? As a trustless escrow if you want to do a transaction already agreed upon with a friend/a third party?

Author: namax#5496
Content: There's no market discovery, chart, order book, limit/spot orders or anything like that. So as an exchange set to provide liquidity it isn't efficient as there's no visibility on the other side (buyers when you want to sell or sellers when you want to buy)

Author: namax#5496
Content: I tried a small test: buy few hush with KMD but I had to go on CMC to evaluate the fair value for the pair first. Then my order is pending and I have no visibility about the other side (Hush sellers / market depth and liquidity) so even if i would like to adjust the price to the opposite side in order to buy on spot (market price) I have no idea how to do that

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@namax 
> There's no market discovery, chart, order book
there is, though
we have a p2p orderbook

it is just not displayed in the app yet

Author: namax#5496
Content: then it would be better to just have a spot buy (atomic swap only) at market price at this stage on the app

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> I had to go on CMC to evaluate the fair value for the pair first

when the orderbook is visible, this problem mostly goes away
you can also create a new order at the price you would like

Author: namax#5496
Content: So it matches the opposite side whatever the pair and even if there's no visibility then it is still possible to use it

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: you can click on "create an order" and set a price you like

Author: namax#5496
Content: Cuz if I cancel the order multiple times with different prices (blindly) until it matches, first I pay lot of tx fees and second I might overpay for the coin I want to buy

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @namax market buy option can be implemented and it is in our wishlist

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no txfees for placing/cancelling orders

Author: namax#5496
Content: Should be if it's a dex. it opens a smart contract so a tx. What you don't pay is comission until order is fullfilled

Author: namax#5496
Content: Or am I mistaken?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you are incorrect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is not a proxy dex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is pure p2p dex

Author: namax#5496
Content: Oh Ok. This is good tho

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: posting/cancelling order does not create the contract, it indicates you are ready to enter into one. until there is a counterparty, there is no contract that can be created

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, it is a good design. having to pay to place/cancel orders makes it pretty bad

Author: namax#5496
Content: alright cool. How about if my order is large and has to match several people on the other side? How is it handled ?

Author: namax#5496
Content: can't be partially filled right? everything or nothing?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: partial fills are supported

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
<https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/start-here/core-technology-discussions/atomicdex.html#atomic-swaps>
it will be partially filled

please see the above doc to understand how our atomic swap protocol works

Author: namax#5496
Content: you sure there's no tx fee at the root of the request to avoid DDOS? On the app I have 2 fees associated when I want to initialize a transaction: a (small) transaction fees and a (bigger) trading fee

Author: namax#5496
Content: By forcing a would-be attacker to spend real money, attacking the network becomes costly. Without this spam prevention, AtomicDEX could otherwise be attacked at the protocol level by any person performing a plethora of trade requests.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
taker has two txn fee
when you are filling an existing order, you are a taker

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> By forcing a would-be attacker to spend real money, attacking the network becomes costly.
this is what the first fee you are seeing as a taker is, called the "dexfee"

Author: namax#5496
Content: both are only paid if there's a matching order?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: yes

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: if you are creating an order yourself, you are a maker and don't pay any trading fee

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: once you see a taker paying the dexfee, you (the maker) send your coins to a intermediate address(p2sh/contract)

Author: namax#5496
Content: Is it not automatized?

Author: namax#5496
Content: for the maker?

Author: namax#5496
Content: where are the trading fees going? to KMD?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
it is automated
I'm just saying how the atomicDEX of maker behaves

Author: namax#5496
Content: Ok. As I have no such maker/taker option on the app I was a bit confused

Author: namax#5496
Content: actually the app is a kind of multi wallet with a blind swap feature to me

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
if you use the button that says "create an order", you will become a maker
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/584762059430821909/635034455630675993/photo6150075375108073709.jpg
the dexfees are paid to holders of an asset named DEX

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
the app is meant for end users who will mostly be takers
to become a proper maker, you need to run the cli and we are also creating a bot for liquidity providers

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/antara-makerbot

Author: namax#5496
Content: Also involved in OTC, I think you could addup later on a contract creation for people to load a contract with a coin (say BTC for KMD), load it with his coin and share it to a counterparty for him to load it too so the contract get executed. kind of what trader.airswap.io is doing but for any coin instead of just ERC20

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: there are provisions for private OTC trades using the atomic swap tech, though at the moment I believe it requires CLI (i.e. no gui)

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
```Will direct private trading be possible with AtomicDEX through private needs created on private nodes (not created on AtomicDEX)?

AtomicAPI allows making custom trading networks by netid parameter changing, but some basic infrastructure (seed nodes) is needed.``` 
https://komodoplatform.com/atomicdex-ama-towards-decentralized-trading/

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: more info re:`netid` param - https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-tutorials/atomicdex-walkthrough.html#initiate-marketmaker-2-0
